Name: Coffin
Description: A mummiform coffin made of wood and stucco, belonging to the wab-priest of Amun, Pedjamunnebnesuttawy. On the top of the head is a figure of Nephthys and an illegible inscription. Beneath the coloured pectoral is a figure of Nut, her name set above her head and her wings outstretched. Below her is a panel with a depiction of the god Khnum, with an accompanying offering formula invoking him as 'the potter' and 'the one who fashioned the gods'. In the central panel is a scene showing Anubis attending to the mummy laid on a bier, the canopic jars underneath. To the left and right of this scene are depictions of the four Sons of Horus, each with an accompanying utterance. At the foot end of the lid is a winged scarab beetle holding the sun-disk, an udjat-eye on either side of it's back feet (see fourth image).The figure of Nut appears on the floor of the coffin box, along with a djed-pillar, the interior of the box contains htp-dj-nsw formulae on both sides in a bad state of preservation.
